intro: Ophiorrhiza longifloriformis, commonly known as the long-flowered marshmallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in wetland and coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its delicate, often hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It has a short stem and is typically found in marshy or brackish habitats. Ophiorrhiza longifloriformis is notable for its ability to tolerate saline conditions, making it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
